name: Holiday Inn Shanghai Nanjing Road By IHG
detail: Easy 5mins walk to Line 2 train and 15mins walk to The Bund.
area: People Square and South Bund Huangpu,Shanghai - View on map

name: City Hotel
detail: This was a great room, large, very clean and well appointed.
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: Jin Jiang Tower Hotel
detail: Nice place and perfect location for tourist
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: Oriental Riverside Bund View Hotel
detail: This is a large, Chinese, modern, 4 or 5 star hotel, not brand new but a clean hotel. It is almost on the riverfront. You get a choice of river view or other and pay accordingly. There are a handful of restaurants along the river front, and of course the ubiquitos Starbucks. Some are bars, some cafes, some restaurants. Just take yourself along for a wander and explore. It is a great view of Shanghai, seeing the Bund from Pudong s the best way to see it, especially if you settle down for a bite or a drink. All the options looked dcent, tho perhaps it can be a bit quiet. The hotel is across the road road from the Super Brand shopping mall. Getting a taxi is not too bad, but if there is either a queue, or you just don't see any taxis, then walk over to the mall where there is usually a few of them waiting on the corner. If you dont fancy the standard, expensive buffet breakfast, take yourself over to the mall to Starbucks, or Lavazza or one of the local options. There is also a metro station just a few minutes walk away.
area: Lujiazui and New Int'l Expo Center Pudong,Shanghai - View on map

name: Hyatt On The Bund
detail: Probably one of the best hotel I stayed in Shanghai the most hip and happening among all three Hyatt in the city. Spent my new year eve count down at the Vue bar, very memorable and unforgettable experience, it offer stunning view of Shanghai both Pu dong and Pu xi view, thought the location of the hotel is at Pu xi side. I would recommend all guest to have a drink at the Vue bar to chill out. Being situated at Pu xi, Huang Pu Road the hotel is minutes walk from the Bund and nan jing road where most of the great, shopping, restaurant and bar located at. Very convenient location. As for the facility, Hyatt on the Bund provide better facility than other 5 star hotel in city. warm pool and great gym. I stayed at the club room on the east tower at 27 floor that offer magnificent view, the room is spacious and amenity is nice. I truly enjoy my stay at Hyatt on Bund and will stay here again come May Shanghai Expo.
area: The Bund and North Bund,Shanghai - View on map

name: Merry Hotel Shanghai
detail: I requested 2 connecting rooms when I booked the rooms online, but No when I checked in. I requested 2 connecting rooms for my second visit at the reception counter, make sure I can get the connecting rooms for my second visit, but No at my second visit as well. So, better don't show special request column. The cardkey didn't work for my parents' room several times at my second visit, need to improve! Besides the above, the room is clean every visit, the bell service is good. The internet is slow as usual, and need to pay for it which is free at the most of the Shanghai hotels. Overall, it is a good hotel with the reasonable price.
area: Jing'an and SHA Railway Station,Shanghai - View on map

name: Shanghai Fish Inn East Nanjing Road
detail: Booked this place in 2 min as I was next in line for the transit immigration officer and wanted to have a place to show. I am glad I did instead of booking the higher end places. The hotel has the best location I could ask for, 2 blocks from MRT in central Bund walking distance to Nanjing Lu and to all nightlife in the neighborhood. Moreover the room was quite comfortable, I was coming from Hong Kong and this felt like a 5 starts compared to those shitty hotels in Central. The staff also was super friendly and even bumped me up in the hotel. This is now my default place to stay at Shanghai and I look forward to the next time.
area: The Bund and North Bund,Shanghai - View on map

name: Jin Jiang Hotel
detail: We have stayed at many Jin Jiang hotels in China, but this was our first time staying at the flagship hotel in Shanghai. We were very impressed with the quality, cleanliness, and professionalism of the staff. Booking through agoda gave us the opportunity we probably wouldn't have otherwise had to stay at this 5-star hotel because of the great value offered. Interesting to note that many famous people have stayed there previously, including Reagan, Thatcher, and Deng Xiao Ping. It was also very convenient to Metro's line 1 and within walking distance to many stops and restaurants. The staff was always very helpful in calling a taxi for us when necessary, however. The only slight negative was the fact that there are many entrances on the Jin Jiang site which can become a little confusing to new guests and taxi drivers; however, the staff was always available to guide and deliver us where we needed to go. We would definitely stay there again in the future - with agoda's help, of course!
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: The Langham Shanghai Xintiandi
detail: I booked executive room and it was good choice. Breakfast was good I had better in another hotel in Shanghai. Coffee perfect ! I prefer eat breakfast in executive lounge at 27 floor than lobby because of lot of smell from kitchen. Executive lounge bar open since 6:30 am till midnight and they serve there breakfast, lunch , dinner and all drink including good alcohol. Room clean and big and bathroom huge. Staff really really good
area: Xintiandi and Huaihai Rd,Shanghai - View on map

name: Metropolo Xincheng Hotel, The Bund Shanghai
detail: Architecture and history buffs will love Bund Circle and spend hours researching its four spledid Art Deco buildings. The hotel interior is renovated 'Art Deco' - need I say more? - but the room we had was spacious and very well-appointed. The staff were very helpful indeed. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from East Nanjing Road metro station, that has connections to Pudong Airport and Hongqiao Airport and Railway Station. We can't comment on the hotel's dining room as we prefer to eat out. Down the road are local dumpling and noodle restaurants, and in the next block is Shanghai Grandmother - a bright and cheerful restaurant that sells authentic local food to tourists - not many Europeans, most tourists in China are Chinese. For many people, Jiangsu cuisine is China's finest, with its subtle, harmonious flavours and gentle (in Shanghai, not so gentle) sweetness. And next door is 'House of Blues and Jazz', a fantastic late night out - bands play from around 9.30. 50RMB cover charge
area: The Bund and North Bund,Shanghai - View on map
